intro: Epilobium smyrnaeum, commonly known as the Smyrna willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink to purple flowers during the summer months. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other flowering plants with similar characteristics. Epilobium smyrnaeum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to stabilize soil in challenging environments.
